subtitle.text: and I will tell you about myself: my name is Tom Preston Werner,
subtitle.translation: y voy a contarles de mí mismo: me llamo Tom Preston Werner,

subtitle.translation: trabajo en una empresa llamada Github,

subtitle.text: So, may I ask you a question:
subtitle.translation: Déjenme hacerles una pregunta:

subtitle.text: Why do companies exist?
subtitle.translation: ¿Por qué existen las empresas?

subtitle.text: Exactly, most people would say: Money.
subtitle.translation: Exactamente, la mayoría de la gente diría: Dinero.

subtitle.text: Right, we start a company so we can make money,
subtitle.translation: Bien, uno crea una compañía de forma a poder ganar dinero,

subtitle.text: so we can make money... That's interesting, now listen it:
subtitle.translation: de forma a poder ganas dinero... Eso es interesante, ahora escúchenlo de nuevo:

subtitle.text: We start companies to make money.
subtitle.translation: Uno crea una empresa para ganar dinero.

subtitle.text: Money is just an abstract thing,
subtitle.translation: El dinero no es más que una cosa abstracta,

subtitle.text: it's not even pretty real, is it?
subtitle.translation: ni siquiera es completamente real, ¿cierto?

subtitle.text: It's a concept that we invented, so we could buy things,
subtitle.translation: Es un concepto que hemos inventado de manera a poder comprar cosas,

subtitle.text: so we could acquire things, and sell things without having to trade objects in the real life.
subtitle.translation: adquirir cosas, y vender cosas sin tener que intercambiar objetos reales.

subtitle.text: We added the flexibility doing that.
subtitle.translation: Ganamos flexibilidad haciendo eso.

subtitle.text: But it, by itself, really has no value, so I would say:
subtitle.translation: Sin embargo, en sí, no tiene ningún valor, por eso yo preguntaría:

subtitle.text: Why do we start companies? Because of money?
subtitle.translation: Por qué uno crea una empresa? Por el dinero?

subtitle.text: Not because of comp... not because of money, but because of people.
subtitle.translation: No por el dinero, sino por las personas.

subtitle.text: Because really: what is a company?
subtitle.translation: Porque, en serio: qué es una empresa?

subtitle.text: A company is a collection of people.
subtitle.translation: Una empresa es una colección de personas.

subtitle.text: Right. There is nothing to a company really except the people that work there and their minds.
subtitle.translation: Bien. En una empresa no hay nada real más allá de las personas que trabajan en ella, y de sus mentes.

subtitle.text: So, for me, a company is not so much about the money;
subtitle.translation: Por eso, para mí, una empresa no tiene tanto que ver con el dinero;

subtitle.text: that's not the primary thing about a company.
subtitle.translation: eso no es el elemento central de una empresa.

subtitle.text: The primary thing about a company, is the people behind it.
subtitle.translation: El elemento central de una empresa son las personas que están detrás.

subtitle.text: Also let's look a little further into some of the motivations that we have for making decisions.
subtitle.translation: Ahora miremos un poco más allá y veamos algunas de los motivaciones que tenemos a la hora de tomar decisiones.

subtitle.text: What are the reasons why we do things, within companies?
subtitle.translation: Por qué razones hacemos las cosas en nuestras empresas?

subtitle.text: There is a whole bunch of them, there are thing like:
subtitle.translation: Hay un montón, son cosas como:

subtitle.text: Money. Speed.
subtitle.translation: Dinero. Velocidad.

subtitle.text: The quality of what you're making.
subtitle.translation: La calidad de lo que uno está haciendo.

subtitle.text: How efficient are we in doing that.
subtitle.translation: Cuan eficientes somos haciéndolo.

subtitle.text: How happy are we in making those things happen.
subtitle.translation: Cuan felices somos permitiendo que esas cosas se den.

subtitle.text: The control that we have over our employees, or our investors, or our customers.
subtitle.translation: El control que tenemos sobre nuestros empleados, nuestros inversores, o nuestros clientes.

subtitle.text: What impact is the product that we make is going to have?
subtitle.translation: Qué impacto es el que va a tener el producto que fabricamos?

subtitle.text: These are already interesting things that drive decisions,
subtitle.translation: Estas son todas cosas interesantes que motivan nuestras decisiones,

subtitle.text: but indeed the two most interesting things out of that collection,
subtitle.translation: pero los dos elementos más interesantes de esta colección,

subtitle.text: above all the things that drive us within our company,
subtitle.translation: por encima de todas las otras cosas que nos hacen actuar en nuestra empresa,

subtitle.text: are these two:
subtitle.translation: son estas dos:

subtitle.text: Money, and happiness.
subtitle.translation: Dinero, y felicidad.

subtitle.text: And most people would say that these two are counter to each other.
subtitle.translation: Y la mayoría de la gente diría que esas dos son contrarias una a la otra.

subtitle.text: That you can either save money and have an unhappy experience, right?
subtitle.translation: Que uno puede ahorrar dinero y tener una experiencia poco feliz, ¿cierto?

subtitle.text: Because you're not buying as much good stuff or spending as much money on something as you could;
subtitle.translation: porque uno no está comprando tantas cosas buenas o gastando tanto dinero en algo como uno podría,

subtitle.text: or you can be very happy by spending a ton of money.
subtitle.translation: o uno puede ser muy feliz gastando una tonelada de dinero.

subtitle.text: But... That... that seems to be, in general, what people think. This is how people think.
subtitle.translation: Esto parece ser, en general, lo que piensa la gente. Así es como piensa la gente.

subtitle.text: This is a balanced equation: more money, more happiness, right? Less money, less happiness.
subtitle.translation: Esto es una ecuación equilibrada: más dinero, más felicidad, ¿cierto? Menos dinero, menos felicidad.

subtitle.text: But I don't think it has to be that way.
subtitle.translation: Pero yo no creo que esto deba ser así.

subtitle.text: And I think the way that we can get around this problem
subtitle.translation: Y creo que la forma en la que podemos resolver este problema

subtitle.text: is by investing in humans.
subtitle.translation: es invirtiendo en humanos.

subtitle.text: By investing in the people, that are part of our companies.
subtitle.translation: Invirtiendo en las personas que son parte de nuestras empresas.

subtitle.text: We know a lot about investing for the business, about what that means.
subtitle.translation: Sabemos mucho de invertir para el negocio, de lo que significa.

subtitle.text: When you buy advertising you can track how many users you acquire.
subtitle.translation: Cuando uno compra publicidad, puede hacer un seguimiento de cuántos usuarios uno gana.

subtitle.text: But when you talk about investing in people, measuring those results is much more difficult.
subtitle.translation: Pero cuando se habla de invertir en personas, medir esos resultados es mucho más difícil.

subtitle.text: Also sometimes we don't think about it.
subtitle.translation: Por eso a menudo no pensamos en eso.

subtitle.text: Because it is really hard to track that return on investment.
subtitle.translation: Porque es realmente difícil hacer el seguimiento de ese retorno sobre inversión.

subtitle.text: This is a guy named Harry Harlow.
subtitle.translation: Este es un tipo llamado Harry Harlow.

subtitle.text: He was a professor at the University of Wisconsin.
subtitle.translation: Él era profesor en la Universidad de Wisconsin.

subtitle.text: In 1949, he did some primate research
subtitle.translation: En 1949, llevó estudios de investigación sobre primates

subtitle.text: with puzzles and monkeys.
subtitle.translation: con rompecabezas y monos.

subtitle.text: I guess he also liked building very scary robotic monkeys.
subtitle.translation: Supongo que también le habrá gustado construir unos horribles monos robóticos.

subtitle.text: I don't know what that's about, but he did this research
subtitle.translation: No sé de qué se trata eso, pero él llevó adelante la investigación,

subtitle.text: and doing so he uncovered something which he called intrinsic motivation.
subtitle.translation: y mientras lo hacía descubrió algo a lo que llamó motivación intrínseca.

subtitle.text: Intrinsic motivation being: finding a reward in what you're doing.
subtitle.translation: La motivación intrínseca siendo encontrar una recompensa en lo que uno está haciendo.

subtitle.text: Within yourself.
subtitle.translation: Dentro de uno mismo.

subtitle.text: So think about things you like doing, things like coding.
subtitle.translation: Entonces, piensen en cosas que les gusta hacer, cosas como escribir código.

subtitle.text: If you code after you get home to work at night,
subtitle.translation: Si escriben código cuando llegan la casa trabajando de noche,

subtitle.text: or if you contribute to open-source in your spare time. That is intrincic motivation.
subtitle.translation: o si contribuyen al código abierto en su tiempo libre. Eso es motivación intrínseca.

subtitle.text: You're doing it because it makes you feel good.
subtitle.translation: Lo están haciendo porque eso les hace sentirse bien.

subtitle.text: This is another guy: Edward Deci.
subtitle.translation: Este es otro tipo: Edward Deci.

subtitle.text: He picked up some of this guy's [?] research
subtitle.translation: Él tomó partes de las investigaciones de este primer tipo,

subtitle.text: and in 1969, started doing more experiments, and experiments with humans.
subtitle.translation: y en 1969 comenzó a hacer más experimentos, y experimentos con humanos.

subtitle.text: So he created a bunch of experiments at universities,
subtitle.translation: Creó un montón de experimentos en universidades

subtitle.text: where he would have students do puzzles.
subtitle.translation: donde tendría a estudiantes resolviendo rompecabezas.

subtitle.text: They were called SOMA puzzles, it's kind of like a puzzle where you put together little objects,
subtitle.translation: Eran llamados rompecabezas SOMA, es algo como un rompecabezas en el que uno reúne pequeños objetos

subtitle.text: and have to match them to a picture in a book.
subtitle.translation: y tiene que hacerlos coincidir con una imagen de un libro.

subtitle.text: And if you have ever done this, they are also called tangrams I think in the United States,
subtitle.translation: Si alguna vez han resuelto esos rompecabezas, a los que me parece que se llama tangrams en Estados Unidos,

subtitle.text: if you have ever done this, they are kind of enjoyable.
subtitle.translation: si alguna vez han resuelto de esos rompecabezas, son bastante entretenidos.

subtitle.text: What he discovered was that there is a difference between intrinsic and extrinsic motivation.
subtitle.translation: Lo que él descubrió es que hay una diferencia entre la motivación intrínseca y la extrínseca.

subtitle.text: Intrinsic motivation, again, being what rewards you internally;
subtitle.translation: La motivación intrínseca siendo lo que a uno lo recompensa internamente;

subtitle.text: and extrinsic motivation being something like getting paid to do something.
subtitle.translation: y la motivación extrínseca siendo algo como ser pagado por hacer algo.

subtitle.text: So his tests involved either paying or not paying students to perform this puzzles, in various sequencies.
And what he found is that, if you give someone a puzzle, initially,
and had them just do it for free (you don't pay them anything) then they would enjoy it.
As soon as you started paying them to do it, if you said:
"I want you to do this puzzle, these five puzzles, and I will give you five dollards."
that changes totally what that person found about doing that task.
Now that task all the sudden became work, because you're getting compensated for it.
So this is some really interesting research, and I suggest that you go read about it if you're interested in this kind of things.
It's fascinating and it's too deep to go into. But it got me thinking about how we can take these same kind of ideas
and apply them to our business.
And that's how I come up with this idea of optimizing for happiness.
So, ever since we started Github...
We started it as a side project, we were doing it because we enjoyed it.
It was pure intrinsic motivation that we had, when we started Github.
And, as the company grew, as we went long in time, we've been able to keep that.
Because we're trying to build the company that
we ourselves would want to work for.
Something where intrinsic motivation is the primary motivator for work that's done.
It turn out that by doing that, by optimizing for happiness,
we found that by optimizing for happiness and embracing intrinsic motivation
you can simultaneously optimize for success.
So I've... I identified three different factors
that we can figure out by, well, looking into this "optimizing for happiness".
The first one is people.
I like to think of companies as being build like restaurants.
Have you ever been walking down the street,
and going by an empty restaurant? (You're looking for a place to eat.)
You're looking at an empty restaurant, you say "no, that's probably not good."
You go to the next one, that one is timming [?] with people
and you say "Hey! People really like that restaurant, let's go eat there!"
All the companies are a little bit the same:
if you can fill a company with great happy people,
then other, really great people, would want to come to work for you.
So this leads into a question which is:
How do you hire the best people?
And I think you should hire the best people because: what is the company made of?
People. That's all it's made of.
So let's fill it with the best people that we can find.
And I belive that that's our responsibility.
If we don't hire the best people,
and we later have to let them go,
then that's bad for everyone.
It's bad for us because we wasted time with the person and
we made them feel bad.
I's bad for them because they lost their job and they feel bad.
So how do you hire the best people?
There are a few thing over the years, that we've learn.
One of them is... and how we start one of our interview process,
is by interviewing to impress.
There is something I heard once, which really resonated with me
which was that people want to feel important.
If you make a person feel important, then he will like you.
It's as simple as that.
So what we do, when we bring people to San Francisco to interview for Github,
we hire a driver, have them go to the airport,
pick that person up, with the sign when you exit.
I don't know if you ever had this experience,
of having someone waiting, with the sign for you, when you exit the airport,
but it makes you feel like a king.
Like the most important person in that whole airport.
And guess what: it's not very expensive.
So if you can take this little thing, this picking someone off from the airport,
as so they're, you know, some rockstar,
and they don't have to worry about getting a taxi, or getting scewed by a taxi,
or... yeah, we all have had that experience, right?
So remove all of that and treat them really special.
That's how we start up the interview, and then we put them up in a really great hotel.
So there's an example of not optimizing for money, but instead optimizing for happiness.
So what happens later on is that this person, if you end up liking him,
is much more likely to want to come join your company
because of that great experience.
